response.headline: Mai Nishikata's 'Game Between the Suits' Manga Resumes After 2 Years
response.introduction: After a hiatus of two years, Mai Nishikata's popular manga 'Game Between the Suits' is set to make its return, exciting fans worldwide.
response.content: Mai Nishikata's 'Game Between the Suits' manga, which captivated readers with its unique storyline and compelling characters, is finally resuming after a two-year break. The announcement has sparked enthusiasm among fans who have eagerly awaited its continuation. The manga explores themes of romance and corporate intrigue, making it a standout in its genre. The new chapters are expected to delve deeper into the characters' relationships and challenges, promising an engaging read for both new and returning fans.

{'is_id': '.196030', 'title': 'mai-nishi.response:
[{'title': "
  News
Mai Nishikata's GAME: Between the Suits Manga Resumes After 2 Years

", 'subtitle': 'News', 'author': "  NewsMai Nishikata's GAME: Between the Suits Manga Resumes After 2 Yearsposted on 2023-03-17 11:30 EDT Joanna Cayanan", 'date': '2023-03-17T11:30:00-04:00', 'intro': "Manga's last published chapter in 2021", 'img': 'https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/thumbnails/max450x450/cms/news.5/181960/game-between-suits.png.jpg', 'body': "

© Mai Nishikata, HakusenshaThe 114th volume of Hakusensha's Love Jossie digital manga magazine published last Sunday the 24th chapter of Mai Nishikata's GAME: Between the Suits (Game - Suit no Sukima) manga, signaling its return after a nearly two-year hiatus. The magazine published the manga's 23rd chapter in May 2021. Nishikata launched the manga in Love Jossie in 2015. Hakusensha published the manga's fourth compiled book volume in April 2018. 
Seven Seas licensed the manga under its Steamship imprint, and will publish the third volume in English on April 4. Seven Seas describes the story:

Fujii Sayo has worked hard to climb the ranks at her firm, and she won't let anything stand in her way–even if it costs her lover after lover. Enter her new colleague: Kiriyama Ryouichi. He's obedient enough in the boardroom, but in private, he's challenging and flirtatious–he wants her and he isn't afraid to show it. After falling into bed with him once and insisting it won't happen again, Ryouichi has an assertion of his own: she'll give in. The two agree to an affair that will only last until Sayo finds someone more suitable to her station and temperament, but Ryouichi is confident he'll win against any other man. Thus begins a sizzling game of push and pull that will set their office alight!
Nishikata's Venus Capriccio manga launched in Hakusensha's Hana to Yume magazine in 2005. Hakusensha published the manga's fifth and final volume in 2008. The now-defunct CMX Manga published the manga in English. 
Source: Love Jossie volume 114
"}]
